thread.title: Arts and community calendar: Oct. 18 to Oct. 24
thread.title_full: Arts and community calendar: Oct. 18 to Oct. 24

title: Arts and community calendar: Oct. 18 to Oct. 24
text:
Arts and community calendar: Oct. 18 to Oct. 24 
Sunday 
Music 
Iowa State Singers, 3 p.m., Martha-Ellen Tye Recital Hall, ISU campus, $5 general, $3 ISU 
ISU Symphonic Band and Concert Band, 3 p.m., Ames City Auditorium, 515 Clark Ave., $7 general, $5 ISU 
The Hot Sardines, 7:30 p.m., Stephens Auditorium, $25 to $59 general, $28 youth and students 
Movies 
Cyclone Cinema: Mad Max: Fury Road, 7 p.m, 101 Carver Hall, ISU campus, Free 
Library 
Great Books, 2 p.m., Rotary Room, Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
Monday 
Ames High School Marching Band Spectacular, 7:30 p.m., Ames High School, 1921 Ames High Drive 
Classes 
Woodshop Orientation, 6 p.m., The Workspace, ISU Memorial Union, $20 general, $10 ISU 
Lectures 
Radiolab’s Jad Abumrad, 7 p.m, Great Hall, ISU Memorial Union, Free 
Library 
Toddler Time, 10 a.m., Storytime Room, Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
Conversations in English, 11 a.m., Farwell T. Brown Auditorium, Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
Movie: Embracing Dyslexia, 6:30 p.m., Farwell T. Brown Auditorium, Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
iPhone and iPad Training, 7 p.m., PEO Room, Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
Tuesday 
Music 
Ames Chamber Artists with the Roland-Story High School choirs, 7 p.m., Roland-Story High School, 900 Hillcrest Drive, Story City, $5 
The Sheepdogs with Radio Moscow, 8 p.m., The M-Shop, ISU Memorial Union, $15 general, $10 ISU 
Movies 
Andre Rieu’s 2015 Maasstricht Concert, 7 p.m, Cinemark Movies 12, 1317 Buckeye Ave., $14 general, $13 students and seniors, $12 child 
Classes 
Stained Glass Class, 6 p.m., The Workspace, ISU Memorial Union, $83 general, $73 ISU 
Mat Cutting Workshop, 6:30 p.m., The Workspace, ISU Memorial Union, $26 general, $16 ISU 
Lecture 
My Life as an Undocumented Immigrant, 8 p.m., Great Hall, ISU Memorial Union, Free 
Library 
Toddler Time, 1 p.m., Storytime Room, Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
Baby Time, 1:30 p.m., Storytime Room, Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
Reel Connections: Voices, 7 p.m., Farwell T. Brown Auditorium, Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
Wednesday 
Music 
Blackberry Bushes Strinband w/ Rockets of Desire, 8 p.m., Zeke’s, 3329 Lincoln Way, $10 to $12 
Movies 
Back to the Future Triple Feature, 4:30 p.m., Cinemark Movies 12, 1317 Buckeye Ave., $12 
Met Opera: Otello Encore, 6:30 p.m., Cinemark Movies 12, 1317 Buckeye Ave., $21 general, $19 senior, $15 child 
Classes 
Adirondack Chairs Class, 6 p.m, The Workspace, ISU Memorial Union, $73 general, $63 ISU 
Glass Birds Workshop, 6 p.m., The Workspace, ISU Memorial Union, $31 general, $21 ISU 
Lectures 
Growing the Midwest Garden, 6 p.m., Reiman Gardens, 1407 University Boulevard, $20 to $25 
Are Pentagon Contractors Driving U.S. Foreign Policy?, 8 p.m., Sun Room, ISU Memorial Union, Free 
Comedy 
Grandma Mojo’s Moonshine Revival Comedy Troupe, 10 p.m., The M-Shop, ISU Memorial Union, $1 
Library 
Genealogy Plus, 10 a.m., Farwell T. Brown Auditorium, Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
Toddler Time, 10 a.m., Storytime Room, Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
Family Storytime, 10:30 a.m., Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
Baby Time, 11:05 a.m., Storytime Room, Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
Inkspots, 1:30 p.m., Studio, Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
Coding for Kids, 5 p.m., Storytime Room, Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
Thursday 
Useful Jenkins, 9 p.m., DG’s Tap House, 125 Main St., $10 
Movies 
Cyclone Cinema: Trainwreck, 7 p.m, 101 Carver Hall, ISU campus, Free 
Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater, 7 p.m., Cinemark Movies 12, 1317 Buckeye Avenue, $17 general, $16 senior and students, $15 child 
Lectures 
Women in the Arts, 7 p.m., Christian Petersen Art Museum, Morrill Hall, ISU campus, Free 
The Evolution of Goodness, Justice and Empathy, 7 p.m., Sun Room, ISU Memorial Union, Free 
Library 
Computer Basics, 10 a.m., PEO Room, Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
Baby Time, 6 p.m., Storytime Room, Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
Milk and Book-ies, 6:30 p.m., Storytime Room, Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
Inspired Performances, 7 p.m., Farwell T. Brown Auditorium, Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
Friday 
Josey Todd and Gary Veysey, 7 p.m., Iowa Music Store, 300 Main St., Free 
The Sundogs, 9 p.m., DG’s Tap House, 125 Main St., $5 
Field Division, 9 p.m., The M-Shop, ISU Memorial Union, $12 general, $7 students 
Movies 
Cyclone Cinema: Trainwreck, 7 p.m, Carver Hall 101, ISU campus, Free 
Dance 
Co’Motion Dance Theater Fall Concert, 7:30 p.m., Ames City Auditorium, $15 general, $10 students and seniors 
Classes 
Paint Your Own Pottery: Superheroes, 5 p.m., The Workspace, ISU Memorial Union, $5 general, $4 ISU 
Lectures 
Puerto Rican Student Association Cultural Night Keynote- Xavier Serbia, 6:30 p.m., Great Hall, ISU Memorial Union, Free 
Library 
Toddler Time, 10 a.m., Storytime Room, Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
Family Storytime, 10:30 a.m., Storytime Room, Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
La Hora del Cuento (Spanish Storytime), 4 p.m., Storytime Room, Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
Miscellaneous 
Planetarium Show: Solar System Astronomy, 6:30 p.m., ISU Planetarium, Physics Hall, ISU campus, Free 
Spoken Word performance: Intersections of Identity by Kai Davis, 7 p.m., Sun Room, ISU Memorial Union, Free 
Saturday 
Music 
Cantamus Women’s Choir, 3 p.m., Martha-Ellen Tye Recital Hall, ISU campus, $5 general, $3 students 
The Colt Walkers/Moonlight Sorrow, 9 p.m., DG’s Tap House, 125 Main Street 
Red Wanting Blue, 9 p.m, M-Shop, ISU Memorial Union, $13 general, $8 ISU 
Movies 
Cyclone Cinema: Trainwreck, 7 p.m., 101 Carver Hall, ISU campus, Free 
Dance 
Co’Motion Dance Theater Fall Concert, 7:30 p.m., Ames City Auditorium, $15 general, $10 students and seniors 
Library 
Saturday Special: Talk and Write with Me!, 10:30 a.m., Storytime Room, Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
Crochet and Knitting Group, 11 a.m., Studio, Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave. 
Comedy 
The Talent Factory Regulars’ Halloween Variety Show, 7 p.m., The Talent Factory, 1114 6th Street, Nevada, $5 
Miscellaneous 
Women’s Annual Holiday Fair, 8 a.m. to 2 p.m., First United Methodist Church, 516 Kellogg Ave. 
Ongoing 
Museums and Exhibits 
Fresh Fotos: My First Year Experience, through Oct. 18, the Gallery, ISU Memorial Union, 2229 Lincoln Way. 
PAINTINGS: by Brenda Jones, through Oct. 24, Main Gallery, Octagon Center for the Arts, 427 Douglas Ave. 
Invented Worlds: Metalworks by James Bearden, through Oct. 24, Sweeney Gallery, Octagon Center for the Arts, 427 Douglas Ave. 
The Uncommon Commonplace: Paintings and Pastels by Chris Abigt, through Nov. 14, Community Gallery, Octagon Center for the Arts, 427 Douglas Ave. 
Works by Guy Kyar, through Nov. 28, Gallery In the Round, 1015 North Hyland Ave. 
(Re)discovering S(h)elves, through Dec. 18, Christian Petersen Art Museum, 1017 Morrill Hall, ISU campus. 
Reflections on Glass: University Museums’ 40 Years of Collecting Glass, through Dec. 19, Brunnier Art Museum, 295 Scheman Building. Iowa State Center. 
40/40, through Dec. 19, Brunnier Art Museum, 295 Scheman Building, Iowa State Center. 
Legacy: 40 Years of Important Collections, through Dec. 19, Brunnier Art Museum, 295 Scheman Building, Iowa State Center. 
Selections from the MU Permanent Collection, through December, Multicultural Center, ISU Memorial Union, 2229 Lincoln Way. 
A Time of Expansion: The Ames Building Boom of 1915-1916, through April 30, Ames Historical Society, 416 Douglas Avenue. 
Gwynn Murrill’s Sculptures: A Walk on the Wild Side, through July 24, 2016, Anderson Sculpture Garden, ISU campus. 
Commissioning a Collection: 75 Years of Public Art, Neva M. Petersen, Visual literacy and Learning Gallery, Morrill Hall, ISU campus. 
Facing Humanity: The Feinberg Mask Collection, Conference Room and Display Cases, Third Floor, Octagon Center for the Arts, 427 Douglas Ave. 
The People’s College: The Morrill Act and Iowa State, Iowa State History Gallery, Morrill Hall, ISU campus. Rules for posting comments 
Comments posted below are from readers. In no way do they represent the view of Stephens Media LLC or this newspaper. This is a public forum. 
Comments may be monitored for inappropriate content but the newspaper is under no obligation to do so. Comment posters are solely responsible under the Communications Decency Act for comments posted on this Web site. Stephens Media LLC is not liable for messages from third parties. 
IP and email addresses of persons who post are not treated as confidential records and will be disclosed in response to valid legal process. 
Do not post: Potentially libelous statements or damaging innuendo. Obscene, explicit, or racist language. Copyrighted materials of any sort without the express permission of the copyright holder. Personal attacks, insults or threats. The use of another person's real name to disguise your identity.
